item.title: Druckpresse
item.content:encoded: A modification of Appanoose with the New York system font to achieve a design inspired by classic print newspapers.

item.title: Newsfax
item.content:encoded: A modified version of the Promenade theme, inspired by Teletext and Ceefax services of yesteryear. It comes complete with Teletext style page numbers and R/G/B/Y options along the bottom of each article. Remote control not included.

item.title: Hyperlegible
item.content:encoded: A variation on the default theme with the font set to Atkinson Hyperlegible and the font size increased. Both of these changes lead to a much higher readability.

item.title: Promenade
item.content:encoded: Prominent titles, snazzy blockquotes, and simplified external links. Charter and Avenir for your viewing pleasure.

item.title: Broadsheet
item.content:encoded: If NetNewsWire were a newspaper—and it if were, it’d be a quality read—it might look like this. The New York typeface is used throughout and the favicon has been removed.

item.title: Default
item.content:encoded: This theme is not actually shipped with NetNewsWire as a theme and has instead been reconstructed from the HTML and CSS in the app bundle. This is the theme that is preset in NetNewsWire.

item.title: Sepia
item.content:encoded: This theme does not differentiate between light and dark modes but is pleasent on the eyes.
